page.title: 03APPLETON ROEBUCK WEATHER
page.content: The climate is temperate and equable. {Annual rainfall}is 20-25ins.(50-63 cms.)most in Nov/Mar,there are often long dry spells in spring and summer, but not in 1985.The prevailing SW wind combines with the Pennines & the low altitude to form a slight rainshadow. Thunderstorms occur in summer months. { Winds}vary in strength(0-8) and are strongest and most frequent in winter. The {annual temperature}range is 0C -23C,the diurnal range in Jan/Feb is often -10 to +6C.In good summers July & August maxima can be +30C.(Not 1985) {Snow}if it occurs is usually in Dec/ Feb and doesn't lie long except in severe winters as 1979/80. { Fog}forms in late autumn evenings and can be dense and persistent. {Sunshine:}most in April/Sept. November can have sunny days,winter is usually cloudy.
